Material used.Description: Wild-type and mutant a-synuclein proteins were used.

Readout description.Result Description: The A30P mutation energetically favors population of the bent helix conformation, leading to decreased helicity compared to WT.
The A53T mutation maintained the three-state thermal-unfolding behavior exhibited by WT a-synuclein.
The E46K mutation maintained the three-state thermal-unfolding behavior exhibited by WT a-synuclein.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the literature.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data were analyzed using previously described models for thermal-denaturation.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Helicity values consistent with WT a-synuclein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in helicity values from WT a-synuclein.

Material used.Description: Wild-type and mutant a-synuclein proteins labeled with FRET probes.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P a-synuclein showed a two-state transition and favored the bent helical structure over the extended helix structure.
A53T a-synuclein maintained the three-state thermal-unfolding behavior exhibited by WT a-synuclein.
E46K a-synuclein maintained the three-state thermal-unfolding behavior exhibited by WT a-synuclein.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was measured multiple times.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Not explicitly mentioned in the literature.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data were analyzed using previously described models for thermal-denaturation.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: FRET efficiency values consistent with WT a-synuclein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in FRET efficiency values from WT a-synuclein.
